brewery.brewery_description: Our main brand Maxim Ale was first brewed in 1901 to celebrate the return of the Maxim gun detachment from the Boer War. Major Ernest Vaux (part of the original brewing family) commanded the detachment, which was part of the Northumberland Hussars. Initially the beer was reduced in strength because landlords complained of their customers falling asleep. In 1938 Vaux Breweries increased the beers strength and Double Maxim was born.

beer.beer_description: A hoppy IPA brewed with New Zealand Nectaron hops.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 145 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 30!

beer.beer_description: Dark coloured, chocolatey and honey

items.badge_description: At a new place and don't want to choose a pint of something you may not like? Grab a few tasters! Enjoy some small pours and then decide which to upgrade to a full pour. That's 5 checkins with the serving style of Taster. Try 5 more for Level 2! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

items.badge_description: At first taste, dark ales can be overwhelming for even the most skilled of beer drinkers, but your will is weak and with time you will eventually turn to the dark side. Try 5 more for Level 12!

beer.beer_description: Maximus is a national award winning beer and has been crafted from the finest ingredients to create a strong and warming beer that is also smooth and easy to drink. The name derives from its sister beer "Double Maxim", which has been brewed and sold since 1901.

items.checkin_comment: Probably the best Im going to get tonight. Bishop Auckland does seem to be a bit of a beer desert

beer.beer_description: The first and only one. In 1901, Maxim Ale was first introduced to the North East. Following an increase in strength in 1938, it became known as Double Maxim. This premium quality ale is still famous among discerning drinkers for its well-rounded flavour.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 495 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 100!

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 455 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 92!

beer.beer_description: This smooth blonde beer is very light in colour and uses cascade and first gold hops to give refreshing hoppy and complex grapefruit flavours on the palate

items.badge_description: Wine isn't the only beverage worthy of pairing with a delicious meal. With so many styles widely available, theres a perfect pint for any cuisine of your choosing. That's a beer at 10 different venues categorized as a Restaurant. Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description: The first and only one. In 1901, Maxim Ale was first introduced to the North East. Following an increase in strength in 1938, it became known as Double Maxim. This premium quality ale is still famous among discerning drinkers for its well-rounded flavour.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 30 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 7!

beer.beer_description: The Samson trademark was first registered in 1896. The first commercial brewing records date back to 1932, when Samson was launched by Vaux Breweries Ltd to quench the thirst of steelworkers on Teesside. In its heyday it sold 17 million pints per year.

beer.beer_description: The first and only one. In 1901, Maxim Ale was first introduced to the North East. Following an increase in strength in 1938, it became known as Double Maxim. This premium quality ale is still famous among discerning drinkers for its well-rounded flavour.

Maximus is a national award winning beer and has been crafted from the finest ingredients to create a strong and warming beer that is also smooth and easy to drink. The name derives from its sister beer "Double Maxim", which has been brewed and sold since 1901.
This smooth blonde beer is very light in colour and uses cascade and first gold hops to give refreshing hoppy and complex grapefruit flavours on the palate
Zesty hoppy pale ale

The Samson trademark was first registered in 1896. The first commercial brewing records date back to 1932, when Samson was launched by Vaux Breweries Ltd to quench the thirst of steelworkers on Teesside. In its heyday it sold 17 million pints per year.
Dark coloured, chocolatey and honey

MAXIM BREWERIES
HOPPY AMERICAN STYLE IPA, USES SPECIAL AMERICAN CITRA, CASCADE AND WILLAMETTE HOPS
OVER STRONG, OVER HOPPED AND OVER HERE !!

Lambtons Beer originally brewed by Vaux in Sunderland, now brewed by The Maxim Brewery. Carefully crafted to blend the finest Maris Otter malt with English Golding & Fuggle hops, this beer is smooth and light.

This light golden seasonal ale is brewed with a blend of pale ale and lager malts to give a European character, while its Slovenian hops deliver a pleasing floral aroma and hints of lemon in the flavour.
This new blond beer is a celebration of new UK hop varieties, with hints of peach on the nose and a blend of tropical fruit flavours, delivering a refreshing, distinctive character.

"This new golden ale, brewed exclusively for this Wetherspoon real-ale festival, has a tropical fruit aroma burst, leading to pleasing bitterness, with plenty of citrus notes, resulting in a long, refreshing finish."

Pasteurised bottled beer formerly brewed at Robinsons for the Double Maxim Brewing Company (Jim Murray, the ex Vaux head brewer) which holds the rights to Wards beers because they were taken over by Vaux. The original cask ale was 4.0% and was called Sheffield Best Bitter. Produced on Maxims own plant since 2007.
The beer uses English Goldings aroma hops and the colour and flavours are derived from a specialised crystal malt.
Brewing involves a unique secondary fermentation process. This is instigated by adding a hopped priming sugar at a late stage in fermentation. This gives Wards Best Bitter a distinctive malty aftertaste that lingers on the palate.
Brewed for JD Weatherspoon's.
Brewed exclusively for this Wetherspoon real-ale festival, this new ruby-coloured ale gives refreshing, mildly spiced blackcurrant flavours, ending with a smooth, creamy finish on the palate.
Suspect rebadged bitter
Brewed with Galaxy and Chinook hops
Single hopped pale ale.
An easy drinking flavoursome stout with a hint of fruity bitterness and abundance of dark chocolate and roasted coffee notes.
